text:
In this video, you’ll see how to accept an 
AWS Marketplace future dated private offer.

With this feature, buyers and sellers 
can independently manage the timing of

purchases to improve financial planning 
and streamline the renewal sales cycle.

Future dated agreements, based on accepted 
private offers, enable buyers to easily

pre-book purchases while existing terms 
are ongoing, provide flexible payment

schedules and invoicing to allow buyers to 
pay for purchases at any time, and enable

independent software vendors (ISVs) to authorize 
Channel Partner Private Offer (CPPO) support.

Other key benefits include automated 
notifications about key agreement milestones,

integrated reporting capabilities, and 
accelerated transactions on AWS Marketplace.
Let’s get started.

This is the AWS Management Console, 
where we’re signed in as a buyer.

To begin, let’s navigate to the 
AWS Marketplace console to see
the private offers that are available to us.

Let’s take a closer look at the 
private offer for the SaaS product.

Here, we can review the 
terms and pricing information.
Notice that this is a future dated private offer.

We can choose the contract 
option that best suits our needs.
In this case, only one option is available.

Now let’s create a contract to 
accept the offer for this product.
We’ll select Pay now to proceed.
We’ve successfully accepted the offer,

and the service is scheduled to 
begin on the specified start date.

You’ve just seen how to accept an AWS 
Marketplace future dated private offer.

You can learn more about this topic in
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it’s your turn to try.
